alert.note: Alert for Allegan; Mason; Muskegon; Oceana; Ottawa; Van Buren (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued June 30 at 4:15AM EDT until July 01 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. Piers may be heavily swamped by waves. * WHERE...Mason, Oceana, Muskegon, Ottawa, Allegan and Van Buren counties. * WHEN...Through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Strong currents can pull swimmers into deeper water and high waves can sweep people off piers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong southwest winds will create dangerous waves and currents Thursday into Thursday night. The strongest winds and largest waves will occur Thursday afternoon and evening from Holland north up the shoreline. Particularly dangerous beaches on Thursday will be Grand Haven State Park and Pere Marquette Park in Muskegon. Moderately high waves and strong currents are also expected south of Holland.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions and do not venture out on piers. Please check with your local authorities on potential beach closures.

area.areaDesc: Allegan; Mason; Muskegon; Oceana; Ottawa; Van Buren
